pertanyaan:
Read the following text to answer question number 1 to 5.

**Text 1**

Plastic pollution has become one of the most pressing environmental issues, with rapidly increasing production of disposable plastic products overwhelming the world's ability to deal with them. Plastic pollution is most visible in developing Asian and African nations, where garbage collection systems are often inefficient or nonexistent. But the developed world, especially in countries with low recycling rates, also has trouble properly collecting discarded plastics. Plastic trash is now so ubiquitous it has prompted efforts to write a global treaty negotiated by the United Nations.

Plastics often contain additives making them stronger, more flexible, and durable. But many of these additives can extend the life of products if they become litter, with some estimates ranging to at least 400 years to break down. How plastics are made also is an energy-intensive process that relies heavily on fossil fuels. It's estimated that 4 percent of the world's annual petroleum production is diverted to making plastic, and another 4 percent gets burned in the process.

Furthermore, the impact of plastic waste on marine life is devastating. Millions of marine animals and seabirds die each year from ingesting plastic or becoming entangled in it. Microplastics, tiny plastic particles resulting from the breakdown of larger items, have infiltrated the entire ocean food chain and have even been found in drinking water and human food sources, raising significant concerns about human health impacts. This pervasive contamination highlights the urgent need for comprehensive solutions that address the entire lifecycle of plastic products.

What is the main idea of the passage?
pilihan: Plastic pollution is only a problem in developing countries
Plastic production is an efficient use of fossil fuels
Plastic pollution is a global issue requiring international cooperation
Plastic additives help the environment by making products last longer
Recycling systems are perfectly effective in developed nations
pembahasan: Ide utama teks adalah bahwa polusi plastik merupakan masalah global yang mendesak, mempengaruhi baik negara berkembang maupun maju, telah mendorong upaya pembuatan perjanjian global melalui PBB, dan memiliki dampak luas pada lingkungan laut serta kesehatan manusia.

pertanyaan: The word 'ubiquitous' in paragraph 1 most closely means...
pembahasan: Kata 'ubiquitous' berarti ada di mana-mana atau sangat umum ditemui. 'Everywhere' adalah sinonim yang paling tepat dalam konteks ini.

pertanyaan: According to the passage, what makes plastic pollution particularly problematic?
pilihan: Plastic products are not useful to society
Plastics take extremely long to decompose
Developing nations have perfect garbage collection
Plastic production uses renewable energy sources
pembahasan: Teks menyatakan bahwa plastik dapat membutuhkan waktu setidaknya 400 tahun untuk terurai, menjadikan polusi plastik sangat bermasalah karena persistensinya yang lama di lingkungan.

pertanyaan: The word 'they' in '...overwhelming the world's ability to deal with them' refers to...
pembahasan: Kata 'they' dalam kalimat tersebut merujuk pada 'disposable plastic products' yang disebutkan sebelumnya dalam kalimat yang sama.

pertanyaan: What percentage of the world's petroleum production is used to make plastic according to the passage?
pembahasan: Teks menyatakan bahwa 4 persen produksi minyak bumi tahunan dunia dialihkan untuk membuat plastik, dan 4 persen lagi dibakar dalam prosesnya, sehingga totalnya adalah 8 persen.

pertanyaan:
Read the following text to answer question number 6 to 10.

**Text 2**

The human microbiome consists of trillions of microorganisms living in and on our bodies. These microbial communities, which include bacteria, fungi, and viruses, play crucial roles in human health, influencing everything from digestion to immune function. Recent research has revealed that a diverse microbiome is associated with better health outcomes, while reduced microbial diversity has been linked to various conditions including obesity, autoimmune diseases, and mental health disorders.

Antibiotics, while life-saving medicines, can significantly disrupt the gut microbiome by killing both harmful and beneficial bacteria. Studies show that it can take weeks or even months for the microbiome to recover after a course of antibiotics, and sometimes it never fully returns to its original state. This has led researchers to investigate ways to protect and restore healthy gut flora, including the use of probiotics and prebiotics.

Moreover, dietary choices significantly influence microbiome composition. High-fiber diets rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains promote the growth of beneficial bacteria, while highly processed foods can negatively affect microbial diversity. Fermented foods like yogurt, kefir, and kimchi naturally contain probiotics that can help maintain a healthy gut ecosystem. Understanding these dietary connections offers promising avenues for improving overall health through targeted nutritional strategies that support our microbial partners.

What is the main idea of the passage?
pilihan: Antibiotics should never be used under any circumstances
All microorganisms in the human body are harmful
The human microbiome is important for health and can be affected by antibiotics
Probiotics can completely reverse all damage caused by antibiotics
Microbiome diversity has no significant health implications
pembahasan: Ide utama teks adalah pentingnya microbiome manusia bagi kesehatan, bagaimana antibiotik dapat mengganggu keseimbangan microbiome tersebut, dan bagaimana faktor seperti diet mempengaruhi komposisi mikroba, yang mendorong penelitian tentang cara melindungi dan memulihkannya.

pertanyaan: What does the word 'flora' in paragraph 2 refer to?
pembahasan: Dalam konteks biologi, 'flora' ketika merujuk pada tubuh manusia biasanya berarti komunitas mikroba, khususnya bakteri, yang hidup di dalam atau pada tubuh.

pertanyaan: According to the passage, what is associated with better health outcomes?
pilihan: Only harmful bacteria in the gut
pembahasan: Teks secara eksplisit menyatakan bahwa 'a diverse microbiome is associated with better health outcomes'.

pertanyaan: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a consequence of reduced microbial diversity?
pembahasan: Teks menyebutkan obesitas, penyakit autoimun, dan gangguan kesehatan mental dikaitkan dengan berkurangnya keragaman mikroba, tetapi tidak menyebutkan kanker secara spesifik.

pertanyaan: What can be inferred from the passage about antibiotic use?
pilihan: They have no effect on beneficial bacteria
Their effects on the microbiome are always temporary and minor
They can cause long-term changes to the microbiome
They should be taken daily to maintain health
pembahasan: Teks menyatakan bahwa microbiome terkadang tidak pernah sepenuhnya kembali ke keadaan semula setelah penggunaan antibiotik, yang menyiratkan bahwa antibiotik dapat menyebabkan perubahan jangka panjang pada microbiome.

pertanyaan:
Read the following text to answer question number 11 to 15.

**Text 3**

Artificial Intelligence has transformed from a theoretical concept to a practical tool impacting numerous industries. Machine learning algorithms now power recommendation systems, voice assistants, and autonomous vehicles. However, as AI systems become more sophisticated, concerns about ethics, bias, and job displacement have grown substantially.

One significant challenge is algorithmic bias, where AI systems perpetuate or even amplify existing societal prejudices. This occurs because these systems learn from historical data that may contain biased human decisions. For instance, hiring algorithms trained on data from companies that historically favored male candidates might learn to discriminate against female applicants. Addressing these issues requires diverse development teams, transparent algorithms, and ongoing monitoring.

Looking forward, the regulation of artificial intelligence presents another complex challenge. Governments worldwide are grappling with how to foster innovation while protecting citizens from potential harms. The European Union has proposed comprehensive AI regulations that classify systems by risk level and impose stricter requirements on high-risk applications. Similarly, other nations are developing their own frameworks to ensure AI develops in an ethical and socially beneficial manner, creating a complex patchwork of international standards that companies must navigate.

The passage mainly discusses...
pilihan: The complete history of artificial intelligence development
How AI will definitely solve all human problems
Practical applications of AI and associated ethical challenges
The technical details of how machine learning algorithms work
Why AI should be banned completely
pembahasan: Teks membahas transformasi AI menjadi alat praktis yang berdampak pada berbagai industri (aplikasi praktis) dan juga menekankan kekhawatiran tentang etika, bias, dampak pekerjaan, serta tantangan regulasi (tantangan etika dan governance).

pertanyaan: What is 'algorithmic bias' according to the passage?
pilihan: When algorithms are intentionally programmed to be unfair
When AI systems perpetuate existing societal prejudices
A technical error in computer programming
When algorithms favor all groups equally
A type of bias that only affects voice assistants
pembahasan: Teks mendefinisikan algorithmic bias sebagai situasi di mana 'AI systems perpetuate or even amplify existing societal prejudices' karena sistem ini belajar dari data historis yang mungkin mengandung keputusan manusia yang bias.

pertanyaan: The word 'perpetuate' in paragraph 2 is closest in meaning to...
pembahasan: Kata 'perpetuate' berarti melanjutkan atau mempertahankan sesuatu, khususnya dalam konteks ini mempertahankan prasangka masyarakat yang sudah ada.

pertanyaan: According to the passage, how can algorithmic bias be addressed?
pilihan: By using only historical data without modification
By eliminating all AI systems immediately
Through diverse teams, transparency, and monitoring
By ensuring only one demographic group develops AI
pembahasan: Teks secara eksplisit menyatakan bahwa mengatasi bias algoritma membutuhkan 'diverse development teams, transparent algorithms, and ongoing monitoring'.

pertanyaan: What example does the passage give to illustrate algorithmic bias?
pilihan: Hiring algorithms discriminating against female applicants
pembahasan: Teks memberikan contoh spesifik tentang algoritma perekrutan yang dilatih pada data dari perusahaan yang secara historis memilih kandidat laki-laki, yang kemudian belajar mendiskriminasi pelamar perempuan.

pertanyaan:
Read the following text to answer question number 16 to 20.

**Text 4**

Remote work has transitioned from a niche practice to a mainstream work arrangement, accelerated significantly by the COVID-19 pandemic. While many employees appreciate the flexibility and elimination of commute times, research shows mixed impacts on productivity and wellbeing. Some studies indicate increased productivity due to fewer office distractions, while others note challenges with collaboration, communication, and work-life boundaries.

Organizations are adopting hybrid models that combine remote and in-office work. Successful implementation requires thoughtful policies regarding communication protocols, performance measurement, and technological infrastructure. Companies must also address potential inequities that may arise, as remote work opportunities are not equally distributed across industries, job types, and demographic groups.

Additionally, the environmental implications of widespread remote work are significant. Reduced daily commuting has led to decreased traffic congestion and lower carbon emissions in many urban areas. However, these environmental gains may be partially offset by increased residential energy use as people spend more time working from home. The net environmental impact depends on factors such as local energy sources, commuting distances, and housing efficiency, presenting both opportunities and challenges for sustainable urban planning in a post-pandemic world.

The author's primary purpose in this passage is to...
pilihan: Argue that remote work is universally better than office work
Promote a specific remote work software platform
Discuss the complexities and considerations of remote work
Claim that remote work has been completely unsuccessful
Provide a historical timeline of workplace evolution
pembahasan: Tujuan utama penulis adalah membahas berbagai aspek kompleks dari kerja jarak jauh, termasuk dampak campuran pada produktivitas dan kesejahteraan, model hybrid, pertimbangan kebijakan, ketidaksetaraan akses, dan implikasi lingkungan.

pertanyaan: According to the passage, what has research shown about remote work's impact on productivity?
pilihan: It universally decreases productivity for all workers
It has consistently shown only positive effects
It has shown mixed results with both increases and challenges
No research has been conducted on this topic
It only affects productivity in technology companies
pembahasan: Teks menyatakan bahwa penelitian menunjukkan 'mixed impacts on productivity', dengan beberapa studi menunjukkan peningkatan karena lebih sedikit gangguan, sementara yang lain mencatat tantangan dengan kolaborasi dan komunikasi.

pertanyaan: The word 'inequities' in paragraph 2 most likely refers to...
pembahasan: Kata 'inequities' mengacu pada ketidakadilan atau ketidaksetaraan, dalam konteks ini kemungkinan ketidakadilan dalam distribusi peluang kerja jarak jauh di berbagai industri, jenis pekerjaan, dan kelompok demografis.

pertanyaan: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a requirement for successful implementation of hybrid work models?
pembahasan: Teks menyebutkan kebutuhan akan protokol komunikasi, pengukuran kinerja, infrastruktur teknologi, dan kebijakan yang mengatasi ketidaksetaraan, tetapi tidak menyebutkan penghapusan lengkap ruang kantor sebagai persyaratan untuk model kerja hybrid yang sukses.

pertanyaan: What can be inferred about the future of work from the passage?
pilihan: All companies will require full-time office attendance
Remote work will completely replace traditional offices
Flexible work arrangements will likely continue in some form
Technological infrastructure will become less important
Communication will become simpler with remote work
pembahasan: Berdasarkan diskusi tentang adopsi model hybrid, berbagai pertimbangan untuk implementasi yang sukses, dan analisis implikasi lingkungan, dapat disimpulkan bahwa pengaturan kerja fleksibel kemungkinan akan terus berlanjut dalam beberapa bentuk di masa depan.
